dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Kazakhstan this week, right? The National Bank made some, uh, pretty significant moves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news out of Kazakhstan this week, right? The National Bank made some, uh, pretty significant moves.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. They've decided to hike their base rate, which is, you know, a pretty big deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, Host_A. They've decided to hike their base rate, which is, you know, a pretty big deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank of Kazakhstan has decided to keep the base rate unchanged at 17% with a symmetric interest rate corridor of +/- 2 percentage points.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. To seventeen percent! [interrupts] That's a massive jump. And with a symmetric interest rate corridor too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. To seventeen percent! That's a massive jump. And with a symmetric interest rate corridor too, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank of Kazakhstan has decided to keep the base rate unchanged at 17% with a symmetric interest rate corridor of +/- 2 percentage points.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. Plus/minus two percentage points. So, like, standing facilities are now at 19% for liquidity and 15% to withdraw it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. Plus/minus two percentage points. So, like, standing facilities are now at nineteen percent for liquidity and fifteen percent to withdraw it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Interest rates on standing facilities are also kept unchanged at 19% to provide liquidity and at 15% to withdraw liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But, um, the article we read suggests this decision might be a bit... questionable?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, um, the article we read suggests this decision might be a bit... questionable?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It really raises an eyebrow. It says the decision was made "regardless of risks" for price stability, financial stability, and even the economic growth outlook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It really raises an eyebrow. It says the decision was made regardless of risks for price stability, financial stability, and even the economic growth outlook.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The decision on the base rate was made taking into account risks for price stability, financial stability and economic growth outlook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're not really, uh, considering the broader economic impact on, say, demand for Tenge assets?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're not really, uh, considering the broader economic impact on, say, demand for Tenge assets?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Keeping the base rate at the same level in terms of economic slowdown indicates the necessity to ensure the demand for tenge assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Keeping the base rate at the same level during an economic slowdown, it just shows irrelevance in ensuring demand for their own currency.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Keeping the base rate at the same level during an economic slowdown, it just shows irrelevance in ensuring demand for their own currency.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Keeping the base rate at the same level in terms of economic slowdown indicates the necessity to ensure the demand for tenge assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And speaking of currency, the dollarization thing? That's back again?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And speaking of currency, the dollarization thing? That's back again?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's resumed, unfortunately. The domestic financial market is showing instability in currency preferences for depositors. Not a good sign.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's resumed, unfortunately. The domestic financial market is showing instability in currency preferences for depositors. Not a good sign.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Situation in the domestic financial market indicates stabilization in the currency preferences of banking depositors dollarization of bank deposits has stopped.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, their measures to make Tenge instruments more attractive, those haven't really worked then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, their measures to make Tenge instruments more attractive, those haven't really worked then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Doesn't seem like it. The article implies they won't continue to influence population preferences towards national currency deposits.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Doesn't seem like it. The article implies they won't continue to influence population preferences towards national currency deposits.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Banks measures to increase the attractiveness of tenge instruments will continue to influence on the gradual change in population preferences in favor of national currency deposits.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's inflation, which is, like, the big elephant in the room.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's inflation, which is, like, the big elephant in the room.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it is. Headline inflation hit 15.2% year-on-year back in February 2016.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it is. Headline inflation hit fifteen point two percent year-on-year back in February twenty sixteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In February 2016 headline inflation reached 15.2% year-on-year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the central bank actually *anticipated* that a year prior? So what's, uh, what's changed now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the central bank actually anticipated that a year prior? So what's, uh, what's changed now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the factors determining inflation *have* changed. And they now expect headline inflation to *increase* in the second half of the year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the factors determining inflation have changed. And they now expect headline inflation to increase in the second half of the year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Factors that determine inflation remained the same. The National Bank of Kazakhstan expects that headline inflation will slow down in the second half of the year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which means there's, like, no way they're hitting their objective range of 6-8 percent by the end of 2016, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which means there's, like, no way they're hitting their objective range of six to eight percent by the end of twenty sixteen, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it will approach to the upper boundary of the objective range of 6-8 percent by the end of 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely zero chance. It's just never going to approach that upper boundary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely zero chance. It's just never going to approach that upper boundary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it will approach to the upper boundary of the objective range of 6-8 percent by the end of 2016.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It kinda makes you wonder if they're even listening to local businesses, or, you know, taking their concerns into account.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It kinda makes you wonder if they're even listening to local businesses, or, you know, taking their concerns into account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The article certainly thinks they should be. It says it's time to "abandon stakeholder engagement system instead of voicing concern." Pretty strong language.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The article certainly thinks they should be. It says it's time to abandon stakeholder engagement system instead of voicing concern. Pretty strong language.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its time to shape stakeholder engagement system instead of voicing concern...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, a pretty critical assessment of the National Bank's strategy then.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, a pretty critical assessment of the National Bank's strategy then.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. And another decision is coming on May 5th, so we'll see if they, uh, change course at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. And another decision is coming on May fifth, so we'll see if they, uh, change course at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The next decision of the National Bank of Kazakhstan on the base rate will be announced on May 5, 2016.
